message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product for $200. This is an exclusive opportunity to own a high-quality item that's worth more than its face value. Don't miss out on this chance to elevate your collection or experience.
I'm interested in the product, but $200 is a bit out of my budget. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $150?

Thank you for your interest, Bob. I appreciate your feedback and understand your budget constraints. However, I must maintain the value of our product. I am unable to lower the price below $200. If you're still interested, let's keep the offer at $200.
I understand that you want to maintain the value of the product, but I'm still not comfortable paying $200. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $175?

I see you're trying to find a fair price, Bob. While I would prefer to sell at $200, I understand the dynamics of negotiation. I'm willing to consider $185 as a compromise, hoping we can reach a mutually beneficial agreement.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $185 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to go up to $180, but that's as high as I can go. Can you meet me at $180?
